channel.title: Talawanda High School News
channel.description: News and announcements from Talawanda High School, including events, athletics, clubs, and important dates.

item.title: Community Meals, Food Pantries, and SNAP Information
item.description:
Talawanda School District provides access to several food assistance resources: - Calendar of community meals and TOPPS schedule - Shows when and where free community meals are available - Complete list of Butler County food pantries - Directory of all local food pantries in the area - SNAP (food assistance) information - Details about applying for government food assistance benefits

Additional resources include Little Free Pantries at all TSD buildings (restocked weekly), Backpack Program at elementary schools (food provided Thursdays/Fridays), and emergency food boxes available within 24 hours.

View original newsletter

item.title: PUSH Program Home Repair Grants Available
item.description:
PUSH Program provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs. For more information or to apply, contact Jeanne or Sabrina at 513-523-8100 or visit http://www.push-oxford.org/.

View original newsletter

item.title: FCCLA Hosts Annual Veterans Day Breakfast
item.description:
FCCLA is hosting the Annual Veterans Day Breakfast and Assembly on Tuesday, November 11, 2025 at Talawanda High School (5301 University Park Blvd. Oxford, Ohio 45056). Breakfast begins at 7:30 AM followed by an assembly at 9:00 AM. All veterans and one guest are invited to attend. RSVP approval is required - please scan the QR code or email croucherk@talawanda.org with the veteran's full name, branch of service, and total number attending.

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: BRAVE Day for Sophomores - November 14th
item.description:
BRAVE Day is Talawanda High School's annual family building, diversity, and anti-bullying event for sophomores only, taking place Friday, November 14th. The day focuses on helping students realize they're not alone and building community through sharing stories, activities, and listening. Students participate voluntarily and are encouraged to attend, but those who feel they would not benefit may stay in their regular classes instead.

View original newsletter

item.title: Veterans Day Breakfast and Assembly
item.description:
FCCLA is hosting the Annual Veterans Day Breakfast and Assembly on Tuesday, November 11, 2025 at Talawanda High School (5301 University Park Blvd, Oxford, OH 45056). Breakfast begins at 7:30 AM and the assembly at 9:00 AM. All veterans and one guest are invited to attend. RSVP required - scan the QR code or email Mrs. Croucher at croucherk@talawanda.org with the veteran's full name, branch, and total number attending. Event sponsored by BT/Talawanda FCCLA & THS.

item.title: FCCLA Blood Drive - Save Lives
item.description:
FCCLA is hosting a blood drive on November 7, 2025 from 8:00 AM to 12:00 PM at the Talawanda Intermediate Auxiliary Gym. The drive addresses the American blood shortage and helps those needing blood for illnesses, transplants, and other medical needs. Healthy individuals aged 16-65 can donate. Free snacks and 1 hour of rest provided. TSD approved for distribution. For more information: +513-273-3200 or CROUCHERK@TALAWANDA.ORG

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: Club Meetings Schedule for November 3-7
item.description:
Weekly club meetings scheduled November 3-7: - Monday, Nov 3: Diversity Club (room 400), Setting Stone (room 320), Tribune (room 315) - all at 2:30pm - Tuesday, Nov 4: NO SCHOOL for students; Mock Trial 5:00pm-7:00pm (room 315) - Wednesday, Nov 5: Robotics Club 2:30pm-4:00pm (room 412, all welcome) - Thursday, Nov 6: Best Buddies Tutorial (Cafeteria), Chess Club (room 603), Key Club Tutorial (room 218), Mock Trial (room 315), Project Green (room 224), Robotics Club (room 412) - Friday, Nov 7: Drama 2:30pm-5:30pm (PAC)

item.title: Winter EOC Testing Schedule and Information
item.description:
Individual Testing (12/3-12/5): For students needing to meet graduation requirements and first-time testers not taking that class at THS. Contact Mrs. Hess for make-up testing.

Class Testing (12/16-12/19): ONLY for students currently taking an Algebra C or Government class, administered during exam week. Make-up testing: 1/7-1/8.

Emails will be sent to students and primary parent/guardian before Thanksgiving Break with specific test details and schedule. Questions should be directed to Mrs. Hess at hessb@talawanda.org.

item.description:

item.title: Club Meetings Schedule for the Week
item.description:
Weekly club meetings from Monday, October 27th through Friday, October 31st: - Monday: Setting Stone (2:30pm, room 320). Diversity Club and Tribune cancelled. - Tuesday: Art Club (2:30-3:30pm, room 603), Best Buddies (2:30-3:15pm, hallway trick or treat), Mock Trial (5:00-7:00pm, room 315), Robotics Club (2:30-4:00pm, room 412). - Wednesday: Robotics Club (2:30-4:00pm, room 412). - Thursday: Chess Club (2:30-3:30pm, room 603), Project Green Natural Areas Fall Celebration (2:30-3:30pm, meet at shelter with red roof past baseball field - yard games, snacks, and optional hike), Robotics Club (2:30-4:00pm, room 412). - Friday: Drama (2:30-5:30pm, PAC), Marching Band (5:30-7:00pm, PAC).

item.title: Veterans Day Breakfast and Assembly
item.description:
FCCLA is hosting the Annual Veterans Day Breakfast and Assembly on Tuesday, November 11, 2025 at Talawanda High School (5301 University Park Blvd, Oxford, OH 45056). Breakfast begins at 7:30 AM and the assembly starts at 9:00 AM. All veterans and one guest are invited to attend. RSVP is required - scan the QR code or email Mrs. Croucher at croucherk@talawanda.org with the veteran's full name, branch of service, and total number attending. item.title: FCCLA Trunk or Treat Event
item.description:
The BT/Talawanda FCCLA is sponsoring a Trunk or Treat event on Tuesday, October 28th from 6:00-7:30 PM. The event is PSD approved for distribution. To participate with a "trunk spot" (decorated car for handing out candy), scan the QR code on the flyer and complete the registration form.

item.title: First Quarter Honor Roll Recipients Announced
item.description:
Talawanda High School has announced its First Quarter Honor Roll for students achieving a 3.5 GPA or higher. Over 500 students earned this academic distinction, with their names listed across multiple pages. Additionally, 10 students achieved the Quarter 1 Butler Tech Honor Roll (3.5 GPA or higher): Casey Asbach, Clara Cradduck, Alexander Green, Payton Hansel, Greer Kist, Wyatt Hickle, Wallace Howard, Austin Puckett, Afton Sanders, and Nyare Williams.

View original newsletter

item.title: PUSH Program Home Repair Grants Available
item.description:
PUSH Program provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs. For more information or to apply, call Jeanne or Sabrina at 513-523-8100. Application details available at www.push-oxford.org.

item.title: Butler Tech Career Days Field Trip for Sophomores
item.description:
Sophomores interested in attending Butler Tech next year are invited to participate in the Butler Tech Career Days Field Trip on Wednesday, November 19. This is an opportunity to explore career pathways and programs available at Butler Tech.

Sign up here: BT Career Days Sign Up Link

item.title: Senior Yearbook Portrait Submission Instructions
item.description:
Seniors must submit their yearbook portraits by March 27th for the 2026 yearbook. Upload photos at https://snap.yearbookforever.com/snap/index.html#/upload/zHyQp1T7hhSDb3iRg0jPvxM8 using access code talawanda2026. Requirements: portrait format (not landscape), greater than 1MB file size, follow student code of conduct, and avoid black and white photos.

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: Quarter 2 Parent-Teacher Conferences
item.description:
Quarter 2 parent-teacher conferences will be held on Thursday, November 20 from 3-7 PM. Conferences are scheduled in 15-minute increments with individual teachers. To schedule a conference time, email wisem@talawanda.org and include your availability and the names of specific teachers you would like to meet with.

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: Tech Healthy Household Presentation by Project Reboot
item.description:
Project Reboot presents "Keys to Building a Tech Healthy Household" on Tuesday, November 18th from 6-7:30 PM at Talawanda High School. The 60-minute presentation plus 30-minute Q&A will cover tech addiction (why it happens and how to overcome it), discussing screen time with kids without conflict, and practical tips for maintaining balanced relationships with technology. Hosted by Dino Ambrosi, Founder of Project Reboot and digital wellness presenter who helped 100+ UC Berkeley students reduce screen time and launched a TEDx talk with over 2 million views. All attendees receive actionable resources and dinner table discussion guides. PD approved for distribution. Event supported by Greater Oxford Community Foundation. Visit https://projectreboot.school for more information.

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter
